©1995-2007 Gazetteer for Scotland
A village in the Badenoch district of Highland Council Area
column2: Kingussie lies on the Allt Mhor in the upper valley of the River Spey
column3: 70 miles (113 km) north of Perth. The Cairngorm Mountains rise to the east and the Monadhliath Mountains to the west. Created a burgh of barony in 1464
column4: Kingussie was laid out in its present form as a planned village in 1799 by the Duke of Gordon. The arrival of the Highland Railway in 1863 stimulated tourism and an 18-hole golf course was created in 1890. Three years later the Camanachd Association
column5: which regulates the game of shinty
column6: was formed here. Between 1974 and 1996 Kingussie was the administrative centre of the Badenoch and Strathspey District of Highland Region.   Bone china
column7:
precision instruments and whisky are produced and the Highland Folk Museum highlights the history of country life in the Highlands.

Local shops offer fresh Highland produce
column10: gifts and souvenirs. While previously a major tourist centre
column11: the town is noticeably quieter since it was bypassed by the A9
column12: which now lies ½ mile (1 km) to the SE.
